VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Diagnosis Confirmed stage positioned above or below the Treatment Initiated stage?
SRP.A: The Diagnosis Confirmed stage is positioned {above} the Treatment Initiated stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Treatment Completed?
VE.A: The value of stage Treatment Completed is {1017}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Treatment Recommended?
VE.A: The value of stage Treatment Recommended is {2881}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Diagnosis Confirmed, with a value of {3815}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Treatment Completed, with a value of {1017}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Diagnosis Confirmed to stage Treatment Recommended?
SC.A: Decreased by {934} Patients from stage Diagnosis Confirmed to stage Treatment Recommended.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Treatment Initiated to stage Treatment Completed?
SC.A: Decreased by {841} Patients from stage Treatment Initiated to stage Treatment Completed.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 3348? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 3348? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Treatment Recommended} stage has {2881}, the {Treatment Initiated} stage has {1858}, the {Treatment Completed} stage has {1017}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 1437 and 3348? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Treatment Recommended} stage has {2881}, the {Treatment Initiated} stage has {1858}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Treatment Initiated to Treatment Completed, or from stage Treatment Recommended to Treatment Initiated?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Treatment Recommended} to {Treatment Initiated} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Diagnosis Confirmed to Treatment Recommended, from stage Treatment Recommended to Treatment Initiated, or from stage Treatment Initiated to Treatment Completed?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Treatment Recommended} to stage {Treatment Initiated} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Treatment Recommended} and {Treatment Initiated} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Treatment Initiated} and {Treatment Completed} stages.
